body: I‚Äôve been using this product for months now and I know what the texture is. Cerave does not put expiration dates on their products so I usually check the manufacture date when I‚Äôm concerned as they stated that their products have a shelf life of 3 years. The reason I got it from Amazon in the first place is that I got one from my local Walmart and it was expired. Manufactured sometime in 2020. I was upset about that one so I got this one from Amazon. Turns out this one is even worse. Manufactured in February of 2020. That is 3 years and 8 months ago. This is supposed to be a verified seller of Cerave. Customers should not worried about buying expired products from you. I‚Äôm going try to find out if it‚Äôs safe for use after such a long time. If it‚Äôs not then I‚Äôll return it. title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
6 weeks and no changes
body: I used it for 6 weeks straight. Went on vacation and a couple weeks later started up again.Pros: One pump is all I need to cover all the areas desired on my face and neck. It's easy to dispense. Oddly enough, it feels kind of good going on my skin. I've had no bad reactions to it. There. I said a few positive things! Haha.Cons: Pertaining to my reactions comment, I've actually had no reaction to it good or bad. Fine lines are the same, small amount of zits are the same, larger pores are the same. Everything is the same.Remember the funny TV sitcom, "Seinfeld" and the show about nothing? Well, the expensive, tiny, little bottle of CeraVe, for me, has been the lotion about nothing, with the joke on me.CeraVe, I would accept a refund any time or an exchange for another product that might actually be helpful.

title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
This destroyed my face and I had to see a Derm...
body: Everything is not for everyone, I took picture before during and after. Started in July and by the time I made an appointment with a Dermatologist in September, my face was unrecognizable...so glad we are in masks! My acne was minimal and monthly before starting but now I have to work to repair what was destroyed. I have combination skin and when I spoke with the Derm she emphasized that I can't use the past few months as my skin prepping or purging for anything. The Cervae would not have cured the bacterial infection I obtained from using it. I was put on Doxycycline and Retin A .05%. I trusted my gut that my progress was abnormal and my face was a painful, consistent  mess; Although is over the counter, please consult your Derm if you have one or don't start until you have one. This $17 dollar cream cost me over $200 in the specialist fees so I can get the clear face I had prior (I do have insurance but deductibles and all that crap)
